headline.main: Court Victory For Makers Of Cigarettes On Ingredients

docs.abstract: Boston Federal Dist Judge George A O'Toole declares unconstitutional Massachusetts law requiring tobacco companies to list ingredients of their products; says it forces companies to give away trade secrets (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has declared a state law requiring tobacco companies to list the ingredients of their products unconstitutional, saying it forces the companies to give away trade secrets. In a decision released on Friday, the judge, George A. O'Toole of federal District Court, said the law would make it easy for competitors to duplicate popular brands.
